form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of the Air Force to make competitive grants to support research and development, education, and training to produce a bio-based aviation fuel for use by the Air Force.

section.header: Bio-based aviation fuel research and development, education, and training efforts

paragraph.text: The Secretary of the Air Force may make a grant, on a competitive basis, to an existing biofuels research center in the United States to conduct pilot-scale research, development, and testing of bio-based fuels that are suitable for use by the Air Force as an aviation fuel for jet aircraft.

Grant funds provided under paragraph (1) may also be used by the grant recipient to train military and civilian personnel in the new technologies and to conduct a study regarding the economic feasibility of a full-scale bio-based aviation fuel production facility.
Grant applicants shall submit an application to the Secretary of the Air Force at such time, in such manner, and accompanied by such information as the Secretary may reasonably require.
In conducting the competition for selection of the grant recipient, the Secretary shall give a preference to an existing biofuels research center in the United States that—

subparagraph.text: has the capacity and expertise necessary to quickly and efficiently conduct the pilot-scale research, development, and testing described in subsection (a)(1); and
is located in close proximity to—

clause.text: the raw materials specified in subparagraph (B) of subsection (a)(1);
a military installation with responsibility for military air transportation; and
a private or commercial airport with capacity to host a research and pilot production facility.

subsection.text: Grants under subsection (a) may not exceed a total $25,000,000. With the approval of the Secretary of the Air Force, grant funds may be used for infrastructure to facilitate the pilot-scale research, development, and testing described in subsection (a)(1).
